intro: Bupleurum melillense, commonly known as the Melilla bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Bupleurum melillense is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
